title: India Govt to address issue of predatory pricing by Indian airlinesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
India Govt to address issue of predatory pricing by Indian airlines Published on : Friday, August 28, 2015
With the issue of predatory pricing by the domestic carriers giving a “bad” name to the industry, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi expresses “concern” over the practice, Union Minister Mahesh Sharma said adding the government will address the issue shortly.
Sharma, Minister of State for Civil Aviation, said, “The Prime Minister has shown his concern over the predatory pricing issue,” adding that the airlines need to reduce fares and not hike them particularly when it comes to emergency travel like in medical emergency.
“It (predatory pricing) is a concern of a majority of Parliamentarians, including the Prime Minister, and needs to be addressed,” Sharma said in New Delhi on the sidelines of an industry event, organised by the Assocham in association with the Civil Aviation Ministry.
The issue had come up during a presentation by the Civil Aviation Ministry to the Prime Minister on draft aviation policy on Tuesday, he said.
There could be three approaches to prevent predatory pricing ways, Sharma said, adding, “We will take the airlines into confidence and tell them that the practice (of predatory pricing) is giving a bad name to the industry.”
A mechanism can also be there through the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) or through national carrier Air India to deal with the issue, he added.
Concerns have been expressed in various quarters, including by Parliamentarians, over drastic fluctuations in air fares.
